sentences.en: A fire caused the premature closing of the exhibition.
sentences.cn: 火灾迫使展览会提前结束.

sentences.en: Even very young premature babies respond to their mother's presence.
sentences.cn: 即使是很小的早产儿也会对母亲的出现做出反应。

sentences.en: His career was brought to a premature end by a succession of knee injuries.
sentences.cn: 因为膝盖接二连三地受伤，他的职业生涯提前结束了。

sentences.en: his premature death at the age of 37
his premature death due to cancer
I had been a little too premature in coming to this conclusion.
sentences.cn: 作出这样的结论,我有点太草率.

sentences.en: I think it's premature for restaurants to come out with that advice.
sentences.cn: 我认为餐馆提出那样的建议太草率了。

sentences.en: It is premature to speculate about the resumption of negotiations.
sentences.cn: 现在猜测谈判是否会重新开始还为时过早。

sentences.en: It is yet premature to predict the possible outcome of the dialogue.
sentences.cn: 预言这次对话可能有什么结果为时尚早.

sentences.en: It now seems their optimism was premature.
sentences.cn: 现在看来他们高兴得太早了。

sentences.en: It would be premature to forecast the outcome.
Others consider the move premature and have sounded a note of caution.
sentences.cn: 其他人认为采取这个行动为时尚早，对此提出了警告。

sentences.en: Premature babies have to be fed intravenously.
sentences.cn: 早产婴儿必须靠静脉输入喂养。

sentences.en: Premature birth is three times more likely for twins, and delivery at 36 to 38 weeks is normal.
sentences.cn: 双胞胎的早产率要比一般的高出两倍，在36到38周之间分娩很正常。

sentences.en: She was a bit too premature in giving up this job.
sentences.cn: 她放弃这份工作似嫌太草率.

sentences.en: The premature baby is doing well.
sentences.cn: 那个早产的婴儿很健康.

words.tran_cn: 早产儿；过早发生的事物

trans.tran_cn: 过早的，提前的，早产的，草率的
trans.tran_en: happening before the natural or proper time
